website_summaries.verdict: Impressive, high-output printer, copier, and scanner ready right away for regular, heavy-duty projects.
pros: Includes toner to complete 5,000 pages of work
Wireless connection allows you to direct jobs from your phone or tablet
cons: No color printing or Ethernet connection

customer_reviews.title: NOT COLOR
customer_reviews.text: I know it was probably in the description and I missed it...however, I was shocked that I paid $300 for a printer with no color....it just had to go back. I understand it comes with 5,000 pages but why promote you can print pictures if you can't print in color?
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: The unit's paper feeder didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed the printer. Followed instructions. Easy. Inserted about 15 sheets of paper into tray. "Out-of-paper" error ensued. Added more paper ...about 40 sheets. "Out-of-paper" did not clear. Finally, after 15 minutes of trying to contact HP support (Good luck) the printer decided to print the test page. Problem is, it grabbed 2 extra sheets. Total POS. Sending back. Stay away from this.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Genshlea

customer_reviews.title: Love the printer, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like this HP printer very much, but.... for a $330 printer, it lacks two main things that cheaper printers have and they are: 1) a sheet feeder - one must place the sheets one by one by lifting the document cover in order to copy and scan - and 2) it lacks a paper drawer although it does have a cover to the paper slot, which is at best difficult to place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Fast and efficient printing. Very easy to install and prints excellent from all devices (computer, tablet, phones, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Max Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Very Good office printer for Home
customer_reviews.text: Due to COVID, I have been working home. I had a Canon and Epson color inkjet printers. Both ran out of ink very quickly and they were very slow. I finally purchase this HP Neverstop -- black and white and very high volume. Printing is very fast and clean. installation to my MAC was easy. No experience with adding toner. I have already printed hundreds of pages and the ink meter has barely moved. More expensive than Canon and Epson but well worth it if you are a lawyer, account or a professional that needs to print lots of pages.
customer_reviews.author: Zoriami

customer_reviews.title: If you are a self employed person needing a fast reliable print look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: This printer was slower than my older Stand alone printer. The print quality at highest setting failed to light colored areas of the documents. It would fail to print if asked to print docs larger than 20 pages. The HP Smart app didn't allow me many options for correcting my frustrations. I have purchased another printer to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since setting up a new printer, and I have PTSD from difficult wireless setup, terrible printer-specific software, etc. I was REALLY pleasantly surprised with this printer and it's easy setup. I had my first page coming out of my Mac, wirelessly in no time at all. The connection has been bulletproof, and the prints come out fast and look great with that sharp laser quality. The device itself is compact, functional, and looks great. Very happy with my pick - no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for Students
customer_reviews.text: Wow this printer is amazing! Now that school has switched to mostly online I needed a printer to print assignments and scan as well. I have owned three printers and they have all been ink jet printers. The price of ink is absurd so I wanted to try laser. This printer has a higher upfront cost but I figured that I would end up saving money in the long run, especially since I will be printing many assignments for this semester. It was easy to setup to my WiFi and I have already gone through a ream of paper. I would definitely recommend this printer to students and those with small businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be a great printer because of the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok printer. It consistently has issues going offline. I have moved it all over the place including right next to the router. When is does print it is nice. I overlooked that it was not a Duplex printer and the Manual Duplex option is very confusing. The lack of a onboard menu makes it difficult to configure. I was able to log in via WebServer and configure it but overall I would not buy this printer again. I have not owned it long enough to tell how long / how many pages I will get out of the toner. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: DJones

customer_reviews.title: Very Glad I Bought This Printer
customer_reviews.text: Ok, last printer was an Epson Workforce. It worked, it was noisy, but it was inexpensive ($150?) 5 years ago. BUT... I probably paid $500-600 for ink in the intervening years. So..... this printer works very well, and I had no need of color printing although it will scan in color. It cost me $289 but.... 5000 pages of ink in the box! Probablyly more than I printed in the life of the Epson. Refill 2500 pages of ink? $16! To me it is a no brainer buy. The minor hassles of setting up are, in my experience, pretty normal. Prints great, fast, quiet.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I bought it for scanning but now use it as my main printer. I really like that the toner is in a tube like the copiers at work. Much more economical and in my opinion HP printers are the best. They just keep printing and printing
customer_reviews.author: S Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Setup Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously difficult to set up. Instructions are vague and sparse. HP Smart isn't working well at all. Usually, I opt for printers with a display. This one doesn't have one. So it relies on the app to set everything up. All machines have trouble finding this printer on the network; inspite of supplying the IP address of the printer. Even worse, the PC app is suggesting that I use the supplied usb cable to it. Well I have on desktop PC so I'll have lug the stupid printer to the next room to set up its WiFi connection. My old Epson did a much better job than this. HP screwed this up.
customer_reviews.author: mmmarcus

customer_reviews.title: I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine it was very easy to set up. I set up my iphone and two laptops in probably less than five minutes. It works great from my phone and the print quality seems great so far. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: jill

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Prints well. Does job nicely. Will update if it blows through ink too fast. But print quality is as good as most professional printers and much better than many home printers
customer_reviews.author: J Fox

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this printer for a while. It works great and you won't regret for paying this price.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice for android users, extremely poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: This "smart printer" was impossible to setup with a standard android smartphone. I have a google pixel 3 and this printer (and the HP smart app) is not functional with it. Seriously? Wasted 3 hours of my time setting this up only to find out later that its built for more iphone/ipad users than android users. How stupid can a "smart device" be? I had to use an old ipad to set this up. Technical support is essentially ZERO. Couldn't get anyone on the phone. Print quality is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Zaib

customer_reviews.title: Okay printer
customer_reviews.text: Cheap product. Lightweight plastic. Wish I had opened the box sooner because I would have returned it. Doubt this will last as long as my old printer. It copies quickly though and the quality print is very good. Not user friendly and didn’t come with a manual. I had to pay for one....download and print more than 50 pages myself using my paper and ink. Sign of the times.
customer_reviews.author: Rise

customer_reviews.title: greatness
customer_reviews.text: It took me 4 minutes to set this up. I hate setting up wireless printers and it was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great printer once setup.
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble accessing the printer from my Windows 10 machines and my iPads. Had to contact HP support via Facebook for help. After several back and forth conversations and following their instructions, the printer is working great from all platforms. It took several days of back and forth communications to accomplish that.
customer_reviews.author: fisherman4920

customer_reviews.title: Printer offline ... and HP won't help
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough printer when it worked, but it went offline and nothing will get it back. We use this printer with two computers. They both worked until husband's said it was "offline." A half hour of googling and effort got the printer to allow him to use it.. Then wife's computer went offline. Nothing worked. Digital Tech Support was not helpful. HP transferred us to the wrong departments multiple times. The last guy got our number to call us back then disconnected us. He didn't call back. DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER.
customer_reviews.author: TMMNH

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: I soured on HP years ago because of a printer I purchased from them that didn't work very well but I gave the company another try recently and I'm pleasantly surprised. This printer is small, compact, prints quickly, and is easy to set up. I installed the HP Smart app on my computer and mobile devices and it's been working without headaches. You have to create an account to use the HP Smart app (which I didn't want to do) but it was the only downside. I would have preferred to use the app anonymously.
customer_reviews.author: mparillo

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Air Print. On the PC you have to have the agent software running otherwise it won’t print. Also print quality is average, print out looks like the quality of an ink jet.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Oh, the deception! I am a law student whose money is precious. This printer worked beautifully for the first 3 months (roughly about the first 2000 prints) then it started having problems. The main issue is that printer won't catch the paper anymore. Technical support is overseas and the process was a nightmare. In short, I have to buy a new printer. This was the first and last HP product I will ever own. PLEASE DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy paper tray and significant bending
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy. The paper tray comes in 2 additional pieces which are both flimsy. This makes it a hassle to load/unload paper. Sometimes, the printer likes to grab several sheets at a time, which is annoying. The print speed is super fast as to be expected with a laser printer, but the rollers bend the paper in 2 spots down the long way, in addition to the automatic bending that comes along with laser printers. I’ll probably return this as it makes my documents look unprofessional.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Artus

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous printer. Wireless friendly, no hassles, fast, efficient, sleek and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi connections
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a paperweight. It is incredibly temperamental to connect to wifi and constantly loses connection. If you haven't used it in the last 20 milliseconds, the printer forgets all key information and wants to be reinstalled. I could only get to it work intermittently through a direct USB connection. This is my last HP product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T Rush

customer_reviews.title: HP Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home use, since I don’t have access to printers in the office for the time being. It is small, but prints good quality BW copies. It was fairly easy to set up, though it took a little effort for the laptop to connect to the printer via Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: impossible to set up no software
customer_reviews.text: No software included and does not work with chromebook. Tried it on another windows computer and some features work but most dont. / Horrible support
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great IOS Apple Printer
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a good little desktop laser printer. Love that you can wirelessly print from Iphones and Ipads.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Vancil

customer_reviews.title: Just a black and white printer, but really great home office printer
customer_reviews.text: More than what I want to pay for a small home office printer, and there is know color, but for what I was pay ink refill this thing is saving me money. It is what it is described to be. It a great black and white home office printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Fredericks

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding printer, finally a product designed with the consumer in mind. I’ve printed off 300+ sheets at a time and it works perfectly and doesn’t hog ink. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be unjammed
customer_reviews.text: Only worked a day and got jammed which requires a technician to fix. No thank you. Stick to epson
customer_reviews.author: Anais Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: A good printer,good value
customer_reviews.text: Well,this one has on screen,so you can't set it up on printer,but you can set on your phone app,however my phone system is Android,the app is can't connect.but iOS is ok.and only have one color,but it print paper extremely fase!
customer_reviews.author: ALEX! LIU

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost printer
customer_reviews.text: Great for small business printing It doesn't scan,fax,copy or duplex print, but perfect for digital files. Very inexpensive toner $14/2500 Copies
customer_reviews.author: Gary P.

customer_reviews.title: This is a reliable workhorse of a printer
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with this printer. So far the toner lasts forever. The print quality is excellent. I decided tp gp with a black and white laser printer becasue I was done with buying so many toner cartridges and running low at just the wrong time.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Burtis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible at trying to connect to wifi
customer_reviews.text: Terrible for setting up I've had it for a week and no luck printing or setting up cannot connect to Wifi or Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: kathysandoval

customer_reviews.title: Hardware problem with printer upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: My printer gave me a "error 59" problem during set up. This is a hardware/internal device issue which cannot be corrected at home. I will be returning this printer tomorrow and will buy one locally so I can test it before I purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: rider

customer_reviews.title: Wish i knew it was only B/W but works well
customer_reviews.text: Fast prints ink last a while but i had not idea it was not color til a printed a few. Does not make that clear. I thought all printers were color. So kinda annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Glamdesignernyc

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far this printer provides everything I need. And it is a nice size.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Took for ever to setup and the print quality sucks. Let's hope that the purchase is good for the environment in the long run. Pluses: - Prints quickly. - Photo copies quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Munair

customer_reviews.title: JUST WORK AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: JUST WORK AS EXPECTED. ALREADY GOT TWO. EASY TO SETUP AT WINDOWS SERVER ENVIRONMENT. REFILL IS EASY AND CHEAPER. LESS HEADACHE THAN EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Shanghai Wholesale LLc

customer_reviews.title: Linux support isn't supported
customer_reviews.text: The Linux software didn't work, (support links were 404). The printer had to be configured via a Windows system, after that everything worked fine, (including Linux). - Bill Kelly
customer_reviews.author: Spot C.

customer_reviews.title: Still does not recognize my wifi
customer_reviews.text: This printer will not connect to my wifi. It does not seem to be compatible with the 5G router we have.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Murphy

product_meta.title: HP Neverstop All-in-One Laser Printer 1202w | Wireless Laser with Cartridge-Free Monochrome-Toner-Tank (5HG82A)
product_meta.description: Model:Printer| Style:Print, Scan, CopyDon't worry about toner—with the revolutionary HP Neverstop All-in-One Laser Printer 1202w get up to 5,000 pages of toner – up to 7x more pages than in-class lasers before your first toner reload. Handle business tasks with black-and-white laser print, scan, and copy functions, print speeds up to 21 ppm, mobile printing, and the HP Smart app—the first mobile print app to simplify scanning and reduce time. Count on consistently superb prints with fewer interruptions thanks to the 15-second, mess-free reloadable toner tank. Stay connected from virtually anywhere with this monochrome laser printer's wireless networking and Wi-Fi Direct capabilities. Plus, this all-in-one wireless printer has up to an 16% smaller environmental footprint, so you can get business done with the environment in mind. Compatible operating systems: Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7: 32-bit or 64-bit, 2 GB available hard disk space, CD-ROM/DVD drive or Internet connection, USB port, Internet Explorer. Apple OS X EI Capitan (v10.11) macOS Sierra (v10.12) macOS High Sierra, (v10.13); 1.5 GB HD; Internet required; USB Linux.
feature_bullets: Lowest cost per page on laser printing: This reloadable laser printer offers black-and-white printing at 21 ppm, scan, copy, wireless capabilities, a 150-sheet paper tray, and a mess-free toner refill experience
Less than 1 cent per page: This wireless laser printer comes with up to 5,000 pages of toner in the box—up to 7x more pages than traditional, in-class laser printers
Reload with more toner, for a lot less: With the Toner Reload Kit (sold separately), get up to 2,500 pages worth of Original HP Toner -- up to 2.5x more pages than-class HP Toner cartridges
The best-in-class mobile print app, HP Smart: Simplify printer set up and sharing with all your devices so you can instantly print, scan and copy with whatever device you have on hand

Print with or without a network: The Neverstop All-in-One Laser Printer keeps your office connected with built-in wireless capabilities, and lets you print from your smartphone or tablet without a network using Wi-Fi Direct
Eco-label certified: The environmental-friendly Neverstop Laser Printer is ENERGY STAR 3.0 certified with an 16% smaller environmental footprint than other printers in its class
One-year limited hardware warranty: Get help with 24-hour, 7 days a week free Web support
See specification sheet for terms and conditions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars175 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
